alert.note: Alert for Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 04 at 2:47PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT AND PRECIPITATIOON... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises today through early next week. A low pressure system in California is continuing to bring wrap-around moisture into the region, along with warm temperatures, which will lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to meet or exceed bankfull over the weekend. The Grande Ronde river at Troy has already risen above bankfull and is expected to reach minor flood stage over the weekend. The Yakima River at Umtanum and Kiona, Umatilla at Gibbon, Grande Ronde at Perry, Naches at Cliffdell and North Fork at John Day are expected to reach bankfull stage over the weekend. Widespread flooding is currently not anticipated for these rivers. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated by Friday afternoon with any pertinent updates concerning the latest flood forecast.

area.areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley
